definition: a rubbing from a stone inscription
a monument/an upright stone tablet/stele/CL:塊|块[kuai4],面[mian4]
fitting snugly/appropriate/suitable/variant of 貼|贴[tie1]/to paste/to obey

sentences.english: The Zhao Zhiqian running script is the rubbing from a stone inscription union side high achievement.
sentences.chinese: 赵之谦行书是碑帖结合的极高成就。

sentences.english: His view on calligraphy is that Bei (tablets ) should be combined with Tie( books containing models of handwriting) in practice.
sentences.chinese: 他的书法见解，是鲜明的碑帖融合的实践观念。

sentences.english: Based on his practice, Shen Zengzhi summarized the calligraphy theory of the combination of stele and calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 他在实践的基础上总结出了关于碑帖结合的书学理论。

sentences.english: In fact, more real regret, such as the arm of Venus, Han rubbings.
sentences.chinese: 其实遗憾更真实，比如断臂的维纳斯，汉魏碑帖。

sentences.english: The article points out the value of three books of calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 该文分析了三种善本碑帖的价值。

sentences.english: More advanced students can follow various models according to their interests.
sentences.chinese: 程度较高的学生可以随意临各式碑帖。

definition: to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting)
piece of paper with short note/short letter
early form of Chinese characters inscribed in stone, a precursor of the small seal 小篆[xiao3 zhuan4]
to practice calligraphy from a model
Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher
Ouyang Xun (557-641), one of Four Great Calligraphers of early Tang 唐初四大家[Tang2 chu1 Si4 Da4 jia1]
